welcome_message_body: "Welcome to charming Worcester Park, the gateway to London! Get ready to experience our quaint town known for its beautiful parks and friendly community. We hope you have a memorable stay and discover all that our city has to offer."

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The oldest terminal at Heathrow, primarily used by British Airways and other Star Alliance airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: The newest and largest terminal at Heathrow, used by many international airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 3
terminals.description: A popular terminal for long-haul flights, used by airlines such as Virgin Atlantic and Emirates.

terminals.name: Terminal 4
terminals.description: A smaller terminal used by a variety of airlines, including SkyTeam members.

terminals.name: Terminal 5
terminals.description: The exclusive terminal for British Airways, featuring luxury lounges and premium services.

wifi.note: Free Wi-Fi is available throughout the airport, but a premium option is available for faster speeds.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Northolt Airport handles all commercial flights and provides a variety of amenities for passengers.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at Northolt Airport caters to private and chartered flights, offering a luxurious and exclusive experience for passengers.

wifi.note: Passengers can connect to the airport's free WiFi network throughout the terminal.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: The main terminal at London City Airport, serving domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Private Jet Centre
terminals.description: A separate terminal for private jet passengers, offering VIP services and amenities.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: North Terminal
terminals.description: The North Terminal at Gatwick Airport is the busier of the two terminals and serves a wide range of domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: South Terminal
terminals.description: The South Terminal at Gatwick Airport is the smaller of the two terminals and mainly serves flights from low-cost airlines.

wifi.note: Free wifi is available throughout the airport, but a premium option is also available for faster speeds.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: This is the main terminal at Redhill Aerodrome, serving both commercial and private flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the terminal building.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at London Elstree Aerodrome Airport handles all commercial flights and serves as the primary hub for domestic and international airlines.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at London Elstree Aerodrome Airport caters to private and charter flights, providing a more exclusive and personalized experience for passengers.

wifi.note: WiFi is available throughout the airport for all passengers.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Blackbushe Airport, serving both domestic and international flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the terminal building.
